<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
AUTO
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/04/ford-ceo-stepping-nikola-reports-earnings?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
We've Come a Long Way Since Ben Franklin's Kite
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Nikola Badger" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xMjk1L25pa29sYV9iYWRnZXIuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Nikola</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Tesla is still racing laps around the rest of the electric vehicle (EV) field, but the competition is in hot, and of course silent, pursuit. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">China’s Nio and Phoenix-based Nikola have matched or surpassed Tesla's 240% stock rally this year. This week, Nio <a href="https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/stocks/nio-stock-price-jumps-reporting-july-deliveries-skyrocketed-tesla-competitor-2020-8-1029463086?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reported</a> July deliveries were up 322% compared to 2019.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Nikola went public this summer through a reverse merger with a <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/07/13/blank-check-mergers-becoming-lot-common?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">special purpose acquisition company</a> (SPAC). Yesterday, it reported its first earnings...or lack thereof. Shares fell on its greater-than-expected loss of <a href="https://www.marketwatch.com/story/nikola-stock-falls-7-after-electric-vehicle-makers-wider-q2-loss-2020-08-04?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">nearly $87 million</a>, but remember—Nikola hasn’t actually sold a single vehicle yet. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>It has sold a lot of shares. Its market cap is up near $14 billion. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Not looking to miss the party is Lordstown Motors, which this week said it’s also <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/electric-truck-maker-lordstown-motors-to-go-public-in-reverse-merger-11596471825?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">going public</a> through a reverse merger with <em>another </em>SPAC, DiamondPeak Holdings. The deal values Lordstown at $1.6 billion and will help fund production of its commercial Endurance EV, set to launch next year. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Jerry Seinfeld voice...</strong>what's the deal with all the SPACs? Mergers with these “blank check companies” are becoming an increasingly popular option for EV companies to go public and skirt the paperwork of an IPO. Fisker, another EV maker, announced plans last month to go public via SPAC. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Electric dreams aren't just for newcomers</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, one of America's more iconic automakers announced a surprise pit stop on its EV journey. Ford CEO Jim Hackett will be <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/08/04/ford-ceo-jim-hackett-to-retire-as-stock-lags-automaker-taps-jim-farley.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">replaced</a> by COO Jim Farley, the automaker's fourth CEO shuffle in the last 14 years. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Ford's undergoing an $11 billion restructuring, which has pruned off products including sedans to focus on successful lines like the F-Series and its big bets on electric and autonomous vehicles. That has yet to pay off—shares have fallen around 40% during Hackett’s tenure and nearly 30% this year. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Farley takes over with some momentum from Ford's recent announcements of the new Bronco and its first fully electric SUV, the Mustang Mach-E.</p>

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
INTERNATIONAL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/04/huge-explosions-cause-chaos-destruction-beirut?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Explosion Devastates Beirut
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<img alt="Lebanon explosion" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xOTc2L2xlYmFub25fZXhwbG9zaW9uLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>STR/AFP via Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, a massive explosion <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2020/08/04/middleeast/beirut-explosion-port-intl/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">shook Beirut</a>, the capital of Lebanon. As of last night, at least 78 people had been reported killed and thousands injured. Neighborhoods around the port, where the blast occurred, were leveled—including the port itself. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Authorities said the explosion came from a warehouse where highly explosive material (ammonium nitrate) was being stored.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The city’s governor, Marwan Abboud, called it a “national catastrophe.” </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>In addition to dealing with the pandemic, Lebanon is in its worst <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2020/jul/30/candlelight-lebanon-economic-crisis-social-catastrophe?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">economic tailspin</a> in many years. Decades of corruption plus a reckless central bank have combined to push almost half the population into poverty, the value of the lira (Lebanon’s currency) down over 70%, and the entire country into hyperinflation, a first for the region.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ENTERTAINMENT
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/04/disney-posts-big-revenue-decline-announces-mulan-will-available-disney-plus-subscribers?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Disney’s Feeling Short on Pixie Dust
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Disney castle" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC84MzIvZGlzbmV5X2Nhc3RsZS5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">With fiscal Q3 revenue dropping 42% annually to $11.8 billion, Disney earnings show what happens to a global entertainment giant when people can't leave their homes.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">It's not all bad? </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But much of it is definitely bad. If it were a movie, Disney’s parks business would be <em>Thor: The Dark World. </em>With parks closed because of the pandemic, Disney swallowed a $3.5 billion hit to its onetime profit engine. Revenue fell 85% from last year.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Studio entertainment revenue also fell 55% to $1.7 billion. This quarter a year ago, Disney released the highest-grossing film of all time, </span><span><em>Avengers: Endgame</em></span><span>, which by itself brought in $2.8 billion at the box office. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But Disney's big dive into streaming last year is paying off in ways it could never have imagined. The company has collected 100 million paid subscribers across Disney+, Hulu, and ESPN+, and revenue was up 2% to $4 billion. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Most importantly, it allows Disney to do things like this:</strong> It's releasing <em>Mulan</em> <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2020/8/4/21354593/mulan-release-date-disney-earnings-warner-bros-tenet-theaters?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">directly</a> to Disney+ next month for an extra $29.99. The remake was originally scheduled to open March 27 in a magical place called a "movie theater."</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Disney also announced it's planning another streaming option for international markets under its Star brand.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Without Disney+, Disney would be in a much worse place. </p>

<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">For time immemorial, HR has stood for Human Resources. But as business and HR leaders, you know that incredibly vague title barely covers it. It’s more like HRAEETMIAC (Human Resources And Everything Else That Matters In A Company).</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="https://www.paycom.com/?utm_campaign=morning+brew+test&utm_source=morning+brew&utm_medium=Sponsored+Email&utm_term=daily+brew+primary+8-5+simple+messaging&advertise=yes" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Paycom</a> gets that. Which is why their <strong style="color:#000">innovative and comprehensive HR tech empowers employees to enter and manage their own data</strong>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Basically, it’s smart tech that helps you get more done. And when fully utilized, <strong style="color:#000">Paycom pays for itself</strong>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But how does Paycom make it simple for you and your employees? For starters, employees enter their own info (birthday, address, dependents, etc.) one time, and one time only, into a single simple system. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Plus, employees have <strong style="color:#000">24/7 access to their own data</strong>. Paycom also helps <strong style="color:#000">remove redundancy</strong> and <strong style="color:#000">improve business performance</strong> so you can focus on success.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Thanks to Paycom, HR now stands for “How Revolutionary.”</p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
WORK
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/04/study-says-people-work-longer-send-emails-working-home-pandemic?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Some Work From Home Truths
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Prepare yourself for the awkwardness of a Zoom office holiday party. Yesterday, Uber said employees don’t have to come back to the office through June of 2021. 200,000 Googlers also <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/emerging-tech/stories/2020/07/29/google-extends-wfh-year-ces-goes-alldigital?email={{profile.email}}&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">won’t return to the office</a> until next summer. As the pandemic persists in the U.S., we can expect more WFH extensions to follow. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">So what do we know about employee productivity during lockdowns? Researchers at Harvard and NYU <a href="https://www.nber.org/papers/w27612.pdf?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">collected data</a> across three continents to find out. The main takeaways:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The average workday increased by 48.5 minutes, as did the number of meetings (up 13%) and the number of emails sent to colleagues (+1.4). </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>But the length of those meetings was much shorter, meaning overall we’re actually spending </span><span><em>less</em></span><span> time in meetings than before COVID-19. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">One more interesting finding: </strong>The researchers say that changes in communication patterns occurred, on average, about one week before formal lockdowns in the 16 cities they explored. So workers seemed to anticipate policy changes before they happened. </p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ENVIRONMENT
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/04/trump-signs-landmark-bill-public-land-funding?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Trump Writes Mother Nature a Check
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Tetons" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xOTcwL3RldG9ucy5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Neal Freyman</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, President Trump <a href="https://time.com/5875569/great-american-outdoors-act/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">signed a bill</a> to earmark a Rocky mountain of cash for the U.S.’ natural spaces. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Called the <a href="https://www.mercurynews.com/2020/08/04/billions-for-national-parks-as-historic-bill-becomes-law/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Great American Outdoors Act</a>, the law will 1) provide up to $9.5 billion over the next five years for park maintenance and 2) guarantee $900 million/year for the Land and Water Conservation Fund (LWCF)...in perpetuity. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">This is an extremely large deal. </strong>Anyone who’s used a national park bathroom knows the system is in desperate need of maintenance. And the government has been dipping into the LWCF for non-land and water uses ever since it was created in 1964. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The economic angle: </strong>National parks breathe life (and $$$) into their local communities. Local officials say Grand Canyon National Park provides <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/07/15/us/national-parks-reopening.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">12,000 jobs</a> for AZ’s Coconino County. And the pandemic, while decimating big cities, has <a href="https://www.nationalgeographic.com/travel/2020/07/jackson-hole-yellowstone-grand-teton-struggle-with-record-breaking-coronavirus-tourism/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">supercharged tourism</a> in other park jumping-off points, such as Jackson Hole, WY.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The political angle: </strong>The bill was sponsored by several vulnerable members of Trump’s Republican party who hail from outdoorsy states, including Sen. Cory Gardner of Colorado and Sen. Steve Daines of Montana.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">+ P.S.: </strong>Bonus points if you can name the national park in the pic above. <em>Answer is at the bottom of the newsletter.</em></p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
FROM THE CREW
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/04/morning-kara-swisher?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Own the Morning: Kara Swisher
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Kara Swisher " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xOTc1L2thcmFfc3dpc2hlci5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em><a href="https://www.flickr.com/people/95021520@N00" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">nrkbeta</a>, <a href="https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:Kara_Swisher_@_SXSW_2019_(47300394972).jpg" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Kara Swisher @ SXSW 2019 (47300394972)</a>, <a href="https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0/legalcode" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">CC BY-SA 2.0</a></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In our first Own the Morning segment, we talked to poker genius Daniel Negreanu about his keys to success. Next up? Tech journalist/genius Kara Swisher. Quick bio:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Hosts a podcast with professor Scott Galloway called </span><span><a href="https://podcasts.voxmedia.com/show/pivot?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>Pivot</em></a></span><span>
</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Is the unofficial queen bee of tech Twitter</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Onetime guest on our very own </span><span><a href="https://open.spotify.com/show/7nc7OQdPTekErtFSRxOBKh?si=Egls0hJdSUqefRA8S5yfFQ&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>Business Casual</em></a></span><span><em> </em></span><span>podcast</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We slid into Kara’s DMs to ask her how she owns the morning and about life as a tech writer/podcaster/everything-er. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Three things you do in the morning that are essential to starting your day off right</strong></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">1) Peloton with Ally Love 2) Pop-Tart and coffee 3) Rage tweeting </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">One thing you do in the morning that other people definitely don’t do</strong>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Have a nine-month-old baby smacking you awake and trying to pull off your Spider-Man sleeping eye mask </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">One thing about the tech industry no one outside of it understands</strong></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">They are not as smart as you think </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">One thing that you are snobby about.</strong></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Only the finest paper towels for me</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">BONUS: Which tech CEO would you want to cohost a podcast with?</strong></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Salesforce's Marc Benioff or the sassy Jeff Bezos circa late 1990s when he was not the richest man of all </p>

style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nWe've Come a Long Way Since Ben Franklin's Kite\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Nikola Badger\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xMjk1L25pa29sYV9iYWRnZXIuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eNikola\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eTesla is still racing laps around the rest of the electric vehicle (EV) field, but the competition is in hot, and of course silent, pursuit. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eChina’s Nio and Phoenix-based Nikola have matched or surpassed Tesla's 240% stock rally this year. This week, Nio \u003ca href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/stocks/nio-stock-price-jumps-reporting-july-deliveries-skyrocketed-tesla-competitor-2020-8-1029463086?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereported\u003c/a\u003e July deliveries were up 322% compared to 2019.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eNikola went public this summer through a reverse merger with a \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/07/13/blank-check-mergers-becoming-lot-common?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003especial purpose acquisition company\u003c/a\u003e (SPAC). Yesterday, it reported its first earnings...or lack thereof. Shares fell on its greater-than-expected loss of \u003ca href=\"https://www.marketwatch.com/story/nikola-stock-falls-7-after-electric-vehicle-makers-wider-q2-loss-2020-08-04?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003enearly $87 million\u003c/a\u003e, but remember—Nikola hasn’t actually sold a single vehicle yet. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIt has sold a lot of shares. Its market cap is up near $14 billion. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eNot looking to miss the party is Lordstown Motors, which this week said it’s also \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/electric-truck-maker-lordstown-motors-to-go-public-in-reverse-merger-11596471825?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003egoing public\u003c/a\u003e through a reverse merger with \u003cem\u003eanother \u003c/em\u003eSPAC, DiamondPeak Holdings. The deal values Lordstown at $1.6 billion and will help fund production of its commercial Endurance EV, set to launch next year. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eJerry Seinfeld voice...\u003c/strong\u003ewhat's the deal with all the SPACs? Mergers with these “blank check companies” are becoming an increasingly popular option for EV companies to go public and skirt the paperwork of an IPO. Fisker, another EV maker, announced plans last month to go public via SPAC. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eElectric dreams aren't just for newcomers\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, one of America's more iconic automakers announced a surprise pit stop on its EV journey. Ford CEO Jim Hackett will be \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/08/04/ford-ceo-jim-hackett-to-retire-as-stock-lags-automaker-taps-jim-farley.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereplaced\u003c/a\u003e by COO Jim Farley, the automaker's fourth CEO shuffle in the last 14 years. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFord's undergoing an $11 billion restructuring, which has pruned off products including sedans to focus on successful lines like the F-Series and its big bets on electric and autonomous vehicles. That has yet to pay off—shares have fallen around 40% during Hackett’s tenure and nearly 30% this year. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFarley takes over with some momentum from Ford's recent announcements of the new Bronco and its first fully electric SUV, the Mustang Mach-E.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, a massive explosion \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2020/08/04/middleeast/beirut-explosion-port-intl/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eshook Beirut\u003c/a\u003e, the capital of Lebanon. As of last night, at least 78 people had been reported killed and thousands injured. Neighborhoods around the port, where the blast occurred, were leveled—including the port itself. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAuthorities said the explosion came from a warehouse where highly explosive material (ammonium nitrate) was being stored.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe city’s governor, Marwan Abboud, called it a “national catastrophe.” \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eIn addition to dealing with the pandemic, Lebanon is in its worst \u003ca href=\"https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2020/jul/30/candlelight-lebanon-economic-crisis-social-catastrophe?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eeconomic tailspin\u003c/a\u003e in many years. Decades of corruption plus a reckless central bank have combined to push almost half the population into poverty, the value of the lira (Lebanon’s currency) down over 70%, and the entire country into hyperinflation, a first for the region.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWith fiscal Q3 revenue dropping 42% annually to $11.8 billion, Disney earnings show what happens to a global entertainment giant when people can't leave their homes.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eIt's not all bad? \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut much of it is definitely bad. If it were a movie, Disney’s parks business would be \u003cem\u003eThor: The Dark World. \u003c/em\u003eWith parks closed because of the pandemic, Disney swallowed a $3.5 billion hit to its onetime profit engine. Revenue fell 85% from last year.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eStudio entertainment revenue also fell 55% to $1.7 billion. This quarter a year ago, Disney released the highest-grossing film of all time, \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003eAvengers: Endgame\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, which by itself brought in $2.8 billion at the box office. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut Disney's big dive into streaming last year is paying off in ways it could never have imagined. The company has collected 100 million paid subscribers across Disney+, Hulu, and ESPN+, and revenue was up 2% to $4 billion. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eMost importantly, it allows Disney to do things like this:\u003c/strong\u003e It's releasing \u003cem\u003eMulan\u003c/em\u003e \u003ca href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2020/8/4/21354593/mulan-release-date-disney-earnings-warner-bros-tenet-theaters?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edirectly\u003c/a\u003e to Disney+ next month for an extra $29.99. The remake was originally scheduled to open March 27 in a magical place called a \"movie theater.\"\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eDisney also announced it's planning another streaming option for international markets under its Star brand.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eWithout Disney+, Disney would be in a much worse place. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" For starters, employees enter their own info (birthday, address, dependents, etc.) one time, and one time only, into a single simple system. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003ePlus, employees have \u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e24/7 access to their own data\u003c/strong\u003e. Yesterday, Uber said employees don’t have to come back to the office through June of 2021. 200,000 Googlers also \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/emerging-tech/stories/2020/07/29/google-extends-wfh-year-ces-goes-alldigital?email={{profile.email}}\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewon’t return to the office\u003c/a\u003e until next summer. As the pandemic persists in the U.S., we can expect more WFH extensions to follow. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSo what do we know about employee productivity during lockdowns? Researchers at Harvard and NYU \u003ca href=\"https://www.nber.org/papers/w27612.pdf?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecollected data\u003c/a\u003e across three continents to find out. The main takeaways:\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe average workday increased by 48.5 minutes, as did the number of meetings (up 13%) and the number of emails sent to colleagues (+1.4). \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eBut the length of those meetings was much shorter, meaning overall we’re actually spending \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003eless\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e time in meetings than before COVID-19. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eOne more interesting finding: \u003c/strong\u003eThe researchers say that changes in communication patterns occurred, on average, about one week before formal lockdowns in the 16 cities they explored. So workers seemed to anticipate policy changes before they happened. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, President Trump \u003ca href=\"https://time.com/5875569/great-american-outdoors-act/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esigned a bill\u003c/a\u003e to earmark a Rocky mountain of cash for the U.S.’ natural spaces. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eCalled the \u003ca href=\"https://www.mercurynews.com/2020/08/04/billions-for-national-parks-as-historic-bill-becomes-law/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eGreat American Outdoors Act\u003c/a\u003e, the law will 1) provide up to $9.5 billion over the next five years for park maintenance and 2) guarantee $900 million/year for the Land and Water Conservation Fund (LWCF)...in perpetuity. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThis is an extremely large deal. \u003c/strong\u003eAnyone who’s used a national park bathroom knows the system is in desperate need of maintenance. And the government has been dipping into the LWCF for non-land and water uses ever since it was created in 1964. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe economic angle: \u003c/strong\u003eNational parks breathe life (and $$$) into their local communities. Local officials say Grand Canyon National Park provides \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/07/15/us/national-parks-reopening.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e12,000 jobs\u003c/a\u003e for AZ’s Coconino County. And the pandemic, while decimating big cities, has \u003ca href=\"https://www.nationalgeographic.com/travel/2020/07/jackson-hole-yellowstone-grand-teton-struggle-with-record-breaking-coronavirus-tourism/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esupercharged tourism\u003c/a\u003e in other park jumping-off points, such as Jackson Hole, WY.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe political angle: \u003c/strong\u003eThe bill was sponsored by several vulnerable members of Trump’s Republican party who hail from outdoorsy states, including Sen. Cory Gardner of Colorado and Sen. Steve Daines of Montana.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e+ P.S.: \u003c/strong\u003eBonus points if you
